intro: Sorindeia undulata, commonly known as the wavy sorindeia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive wavy, undulating leaves that give it its scientific name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
